shortDescription.en-GB: a little wet and cold
shortDescription.en-US: a little wet and cold

definitions.definition: Not dry, and a little wet on a surface or inside a room.

en-GB.text: The bedroom felt damp after the rain and the walls were cold.

en-US.text: The bedroom felt damp after the rain and the walls were cold.

en-GB.text: Use damp to describe a towel that is not dry and feels cold.

en-US.text: Use damp to describe a towel that is not dry and feels cold.

en-GB.text: The cellar was damp and they put a fan to dry the space safely.

en-US.text: The cellar was damp and they put a fan to dry the space safely.

shortDescription.en-GB: a free job or room position
shortDescription.en-US: a free job or room position

definitions.definition: A job or room that is empty and available for someone now.

en-GB.text: The hotel has one vacancy for next week and it is cheap.

en-US.text: The hotel has one vacancy for next week and it is cheap.

en-GB.text: The company posted a vacancy for a sales job on the notice board.

en-US.text: The company posted a vacancy for a sales job on the notice board.

en-GB.text: They saw a vacancy at the flat and phoned to ask for details.

en-US.text: They saw a vacancy at the flat and phoned to ask for details.

shortDescription.en-GB: a small simple house outside
shortDescription.en-US: a small simple house outside

definitions.definition: A small simple building, often in the countryside or at the beach.

en-GB.text: They slept in a small hut near the lake during the trip.

en-US.text: They slept in a small hut near the lake during the trip.

en-GB.text: The farmer kept tools in a wooden hut at the edge of the field.

en-US.text: The farmer kept tools in a wooden hut at the edge of the field.

en-GB.text: They built a small hut in the garden for children to play in.

en-US.text: They built a small hut in the garden for children to play in.

shortDescription.en-GB: on or to the floor above
shortDescription.en-US: on or to the floor above

definitions.definition: To or on the next floor above in a house or building.

en-GB.text: She left her coat upstairs and she went back to collect it quickly.

en-US.text: She left her coat upstairs and she went back to collect it quickly.

en-GB.text: Use upstairs to say that someone moved to the floor above in the house.

en-US.text: Use upstairs to say that someone moved to the floor above in the house.

en-GB.text: The children ran upstairs to see the new toy in their bedroom quickly.

en-US.text: The children ran upstairs to see the new toy in their bedroom quickly.

shortDescription.en-GB: to make something good again
shortDescription.en-US: to make something good again

definitions.definition: To put something back to a good or original condition or use.

en-GB.text: They will restore the old house and they will paint every room next month.

en-US.text: They will restore the old house and they will paint every room next month.

en-GB.text: You can restore a wooden chair with sandpaper and good quality wood paint.

en-US.text: You can restore a wooden chair with sandpaper and good quality wood paint.

en-GB.text: The town will restore the old bridge to keep the local history alive.

en-US.text: The town will restore the old bridge to keep the local history alive.

en-GB.text: They plan to restore the kitchen and make it look new and bright again.

en-US.text: They plan to restore the kitchen and make it look new and bright again.

shortDescription.en-GB: level, without raised parts
shortDescription.en-US: level, without raised parts

definitions.definition: Smooth and level, with no bumps or curves on the surface.

en-GB.text: The road is flat and easy to walk on with small children today.

en-US.text: The road is flat and easy to walk on with small children today.

definitions.definition: A group of rooms to live in on one floor of a building.

en-GB.text: They moved into a small flat near the station at the weekend.

en-US.text: They moved into a small apartment near the station at the weekend.

en-GB.text: Describe a surface as flat when it is even and has no high parts.

en-US.text: Describe a surface as flat when it is even and has no high parts.

en-GB.text: Her flat has one bedroom and a small kitchen next to the living room.

en-US.text: Her apartment has one bedroom and a small kitchen next to the living room.

shortDescription.en-GB: a short sleep in the day
shortDescription.en-US: a short sleep in the day

definitions.definition: A short sleep during the day to rest and feel better afterwards.

en-GB.text: After lunch she had a short nap and felt ready to work again.

en-US.text: After lunch she had a short nap and felt ready to work again.

en-GB.text: The child took a nap on the sofa while the mother made dinner slowly.

en-US.text: The child took a nap on the sofa while the mother made dinner slowly.

en-GB.text: A short nap can help when you feel tired and cannot sleep at night.

en-US.text: A short nap can help when you feel tired and cannot sleep at night.

shortDescription.en-GB: to bend or make smaller by bending
shortDescription.en-US: to bend or make smaller by bending

definitions.definition: To bend something so one part is on top of another part.

en-GB.text: Please fold the shirt neatly and put it into the drawer on the shelf.

en-US.text: Please fold the shirt neatly and put it into the drawer on the shelf.

definitions.definition: To bend paper or cloth to make it smaller or for a design.

en-GB.text: He will fold the paper to make a small boat for the child to play with.

en-US.text: He will fold the paper to make a small boat for the child to play with.

en-GB.text: Fold your jeans and shirts to save space in the wardrobe and keep them neat.

en-US.text: Fold your jeans and shirts to save space in the wardrobe and keep them neat.

en-GB.text: We use fold when we bend paper or clothes to make them smaller or neat.

en-US.text: We use fold when we bend paper or clothes to make them smaller or neat.

en-GB.text: Fold the clean towels and put them on the shelf in the bathroom today.

en-US.text: Fold the clean towels and put them on the shelf in the bathroom today.

shortDescription.en-GB: to remove a cover or find out something
shortDescription.en-US: to remove a cover or find out something

definitions.definition: To remove a cover from something so you can see it clearly now.

en-GB.text: She will uncover the plate at the table and show the food to guests.

en-US.text: She will uncover the plate at the table and show the food to guests.

definitions.definition: To discover secret or new information that was hidden before.

en-GB.text: The report did uncover new facts about the case that surprised many people.

en-US.text: The report did uncover new facts about the case that surprised many people.

en-GB.text: Uncover is a verb you can use when you take a cover off something carefully.

en-US.text: Uncover is a verb you can use when you take a cover off something carefully.

en-GB.text: Please uncover the pan so the food can cool before you take it to the table.

en-US.text: Please uncover the pan so the food can cool before you take it to the table.

shortDescription.en-GB: on the floor above the ground floor
shortDescription.en-US: on the floor above the ground floor

definitions.definition: Being on the floor above the ground floor in a house or building.

en-GB.text: Their first-floor bedroom has a window with a view of the street below.

en-US.text: Their first-floor bedroom has a window with a view of the street below.

en-GB.text: Say first-floor to describe a room that is on the floor above the ground floor.

en-US.text: Say first-floor to describe a room that is on the floor above the ground floor.

en-GB.text: Their first-floor kitchen is bright and it opens on to a small balcony outside.

en-US.text: Their first-floor kitchen is bright and it opens on to a small balcony outside.

shortDescription.en-GB: working for the whole normal day
shortDescription.en-US: working for the whole normal day

definitions.definition: Working the main hours of the week, not a short or part job.

en-GB.text: She found a full-time job and she will start work on Monday next week.

en-US.text: She found a full-time job and she will start work on Monday next week.

en-GB.text: Use full-time to describe a worker who works the main hours each week.

en-US.text: Use full-time to describe a worker who works the main hours each week.

en-GB.text: He studies full-time at college and he spends many hours at the library.

en-US.text: He studies full-time at college and he spends many hours at the library.

en-GB.text: A full-time role often has regular pay and more hours than a part-time job.

en-US.text: A full-time role often has regular pay and more hours than a part-time job.

shortDescription.en-GB: the social or job position of someone
shortDescription.en-US: the social or job position of someone

definitions.definition: The social or official position of a person in a group or place.

en-GB.text: He gained status at work after he finished the big project last month.

en-US.text: He gained status at work after he finished the big project last month.

en-GB.text: People often speak about status in the community and the jobs people hold.

en-US.text: People often speak about status in the community and the jobs people hold.

en-GB.text: Her job gives her status and many people respect her at the office.

en-US.text: Her job gives her status and many people respect her at the office.

shortDescription.en-GB: to make something longer or bigger
shortDescription.en-US: to make something longer or bigger

definitions.definition: To make something longer in time, length, area, or range than before.

en-GB.text: The school will extend the summer course by two weeks next year for students.

en-US.text: The school will extend the summer course by two weeks next year for students.

en-GB.text: Use extend when you want to say that you make something bigger or longer.

en-US.text: Use extend when you want to say that you make something bigger or longer.

en-GB.text: The company may extend your contract if they need you to work longer hours.

en-US.text: The company may extend your contract if they need you to work longer hours.

en-GB.text: They will extend the kitchen to make more space for a table and chairs.

en-US.text: They will extend the kitchen to make more space for a table and chairs.

shortDescription.en-GB: business of people visiting places
shortDescription.en-US: business of people visiting places

definitions.definition: The business and activity of people visiting places for pleasure and travel.

en-GB.text: Tourism helps the town because many visitors come and they spend money here.

en-US.text: Tourism helps the town because many visitors come and they spend money here.

en-GB.text: Many people work in tourism at the hotels and restaurants by the sea here.

en-US.text: Many people work in tourism at the hotels and restaurants by the sea here.

en-GB.text: Tourism in the area grows in summer when families come on holiday to the coast.

en-US.text: Tourism in the area grows in summer when families come on holiday to the coast.

shortDescription.en-GB: a part of a company or organisation
shortDescription.en-US: a part of a company or organisation

definitions.definition: A separate part of a company, shop, or organisation with its own jobs.

en-GB.text: She works in the sales department and she talks to many customers daily.

en-US.text: She works in the sales department and she talks to many customers daily.

en-GB.text: The HR department will send you the forms when you start the new job tomorrow.

en-US.text: The HR department will send you the forms when you start the new job tomorrow.

en-GB.text: Each department of the university has staff to help students with questions.

en-US.text: Each department of the university has staff to help students with questions.

en-GB.text: The clothes department in the big store has a sale this weekend for families.

en-US.text: The clothes department in the big store has a sale this weekend for families.

shortDescription.en-GB: to go away from a place
shortDescription.en-US: to go away from a place

definitions.definition: To go away from a place or person and not stay there any longer.

en-GB.text: Please leave the room quietly and close the door behind you as you go.

en-US.text: Please leave the room quietly and close the door behind you as you go.

definitions.definition: To allow something to stay in a place for someone to use later.

en-GB.text: You can leave your bag here and collect it when the shop is open again.

en-US.text: You can leave your bag here and collect it when the shop is open again.

en-GB.text: Leave is a common verb used when someone goes away from a place or person.

en-US.text: Leave is a common verb used when someone goes away from a place or person.

en-GB.text: She will leave her job next month after she finds a new position nearby.

en-US.text: She will leave her job next month after she finds a new position nearby.

shortDescription.en-GB: an idea or plan put forward
shortDescription.en-US: an idea or plan put forward

definitions.definition: An idea or plan that someone offers for others to consider or accept.

en-GB.text: The manager read the proposal and he will talk about it with his team tomorrow.

en-US.text: The manager read the proposal and he will talk about it with his team tomorrow.

en-GB.text: She prepared a proposal to show how the company can save money next year easily.

en-US.text: She prepared a proposal to show how the company can save money next year easily.

en-GB.text: The council discussed the proposal to build a park near the school in town.

en-US.text: The council discussed the proposal to build a park near the school in town.

en-GB.text: He made a proposal to his partner at a small dinner by the sea last week.

en-US.text: He made a proposal to his partner at a small dinner by the sea last week.

shortDescription.en-GB: to watch an area to keep it safe
shortDescription.en-US: to watch an area to keep it safe

definitions.definition: To move around an area to watch and protect people or property there.

en-GB.text: The guard will patrol the streets at night to keep the area safe for everyone.

en-US.text: The guard will patrol the streets at night to keep the area safe for everyone.

en-GB.text: He works at night and he will patrol the site to check the doors and windows.

en-US.text: He works at night and he will patrol the site to check the doors and windows.

en-GB.text: Police officers patrol the neighbourhood to look for trouble and help local people.

en-US.text: Police officers patrol the neighbourhood to look for trouble and help local people.

en-GB.text: Security staff patrol the station platforms to keep travellers safe at all times.

en-US.text: Security staff patrol the station platforms to keep travellers safe at all times.

shortDescription.en-GB: to give a careful guess of quantity
shortDescription.en-US: to give a careful guess of quantity

definitions.definition: To make a careful guess about the size, cost, or amount of something.

en-GB.text: The builder will estimate the cost of repairs before they start the work next week.

en-US.text: The builder will estimate the cost of repairs before they start the work next week.

en-GB.text: You often estimate time for a task when you plan your day at work or home.

en-US.text: You often estimate time for a task when you plan your day at work or home.

en-GB.text: In the job they must estimate project costs and write them in the report soon.

en-US.text: In the job they must estimate project costs and write them in the report soon.

en-GB.text: Please estimate your monthly spending to make a simple budget for the family plan.

en-US.text: Please estimate your monthly spending to make a simple budget for the family plan.

shortDescription.en-GB: on the other side or very different
shortDescription.en-US: on the other side or very different

definitions.definition: Being on the other side from something, often across a street or space.

en-GB.text: The shop is opposite the station and you can see it across the road clearly.

en-US.text: The shop is opposite the station and you can see it across the road clearly.

definitions.definition: Being completely different in meaning or character from another thing or person.

en-GB.text: His view is the opposite of hers, so they often have different ideas to share.

en-US.text: His view is the opposite of hers, so they often have different ideas to share.

en-GB.text: Use opposite to say that two things are on different sides or are very different.

en-US.text: Use opposite to say that two things are on different sides or are very different.

en-GB.text: The cafe is opposite the bank, so meet me there after you leave the office.

en-US.text: The cafe is opposite the bank, so meet me there after you leave the office.
